content.description:
Tum vero idem ille ex HispaniaHispania, -ae, f.: Spain amicus acrius et instantiusinstanter, adv.: urgently 
“Si frater” inquit “tuus, tuus avunculus vivit, vult esse 
vos1 salvossalvus, -a, -um, adj. = tutus, -a, -um; si periit, superstitessuperstes, -itis, m. or f.: survivor voluit. Proindeproinde, adv. = ergo quid cessatiscesso, -are = cunctor, -ari 
evadereevado, -ere = fugio, -ere?”
 1:refers to Pliny the Younger and his mother↩
content.question: In line 2, what does frater mean?

unit.text: 2: Pliny's Letters: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
